Questions: An 8.0-g bullet is fired horizontally into a 9.00-kg cube of wood, which is at rest, and sticks in it. The cube is free to move and has a speed of 40 cm/s after impact. Find the initial velocity of the bullet.
A 16-g mass moving in +x-direction at 30 cm/s collides head-on with a 4.0-g mass moving in −x-direction at 50 cm/s. They stick together. Find their velocity after the collision.
A 2.0-kg brick is moving at a speed of 6.0 m/s. How large a force F is needed to stop the brick in a time of 7.0 × 10⁻⁴ s?
A 15-g bullet moving at 300 m/s passes through a 2.0 cm thick sheet of foam plastic and emerges with a speed of 90 m/s. What average force impeded its motion through the plastic?
A nucleus of mass 3.80 × 10⁻²⁵ kg at rest ejects a 6.6 × 10⁻²⁷ kg particle at 1.5 × 10⁷ m/s. Find the recoil speed of the remaining nucleus.
A 0.25-kg ball moving at 13 m/s is hit by a bat and rebounds at 19 m/s in opposite direction in 0.010 s. Find the average force F on the ball.
Two girls on roller skates push off each other. If girl 2 moves at v₂, what is the recoil speed v₁ of girl 1?
A 15-g bullet is fired into a 3.000-kg block suspended by a cord, causing it to swing 10 cm upward. Find the speed of the bullet.
solution: Using conservation: (0.015 kg)v = (3.015 kg)V, and ½(3.015 kg)V² = (3.015 kg)(9.81 m/s²)(0.10 m), => v = 0.28 km/s

Questions: Three masses are placed on the -x-axis: 200 g at x = 0, 500 g at x = 30 cm, and 400 g at x = 70 cm. Find their center of mass.
A system consists of masses: 4.0 kg at (0, 5.0 m), 7.0 kg at (3.0 m, 8.0 m), and 5.0 kg at (−3.0 m, −6.0 m). Find the center of mass.

Two identical railroad cars sit on a horizontal track with a distance D between them. A winch pulls them together. (a) Describe their motion. (b) Repeat if one car is three times the mass of the other.
solution:
(a) If m₁ = m₂, then x₁ = -x₂; they meet at the midpoint.
(b) If m₁ = 3m₂, then x₁ = -x₂/3 and x₂ = 3D/4, x₁ = D/4

Questions: A pendulum of mass m strikes a block of mass M and rebounds. The block slides distance D before stopping due to friction 0.20Mg. Find D if the ball rebounds to an angle of 20°.

Two balls of equal mass collide: one moving at 2.00 m/s along +y and one at 3.00 m/s along −x. After the collision, one ball moves at 1.20 m/s along +x. Find the velocity components of the other ball.
solution: Using momentum conservation: v_x = 1.80 m/s, v_y = −2.00 m/s

Questions: A 7500-kg truck traveling at 5.0 m/s east collides with a 1500-kg car moving at 20 m/s in a direction 30° south of west. The two vehicles remain tangled together after the collision. Find the speed and direction of the wreckage.
Two identical balls collide head-on. One moves at 0.75 m/s east, the other at 0.43 m/s west. Find the final velocity of each ball if the collision is perfectly elastic.
solution: Using conservation of momentum and energy: v₁ = −0.43 m/s, v₂ = 0.75 m/s

Questions: A 1.0-kg ball moving at 12 m/s collides head-on with a 2.0-kg ball moving at −24 m/s. Find motion of each after impact if (a) e = 2/3, (b) balls stick together, (c) perfectly elastic collision.
A ball dropped from height h rebounds to height 0.65h. Find the coefficient of restitution between ball and floor.
(a) Two balls collide and bounce off. What is the final velocity of the 500-g ball if the 800-g ball has a speed of 15 cm/s after collision? (b) Is the collision perfectly elastic?
solution: (a) v = 0.26 m/s, θ = arctan(0.120 / 0.228) = 28°; (b) KE before = 0.099 J, KE after = 0.026 J — not perfectly elastic

A rocket ejects gas at 50 km/s at 1500 kg/s rate. What is the maximum mass the rocket can have if it lifts off?
A tennis ball is struck at 51 m/s and has a mass of 0.058 kg. What is the change in its momentum?
A soccer ball (0.425 kg), initially at rest, is kicked to 26 m/s. If the impact lasted 8.0 ms, what was the average force?
A 40,000-kg freight car at 5.0 m/s hits a 30,000-kg stationary freight car and couples. Find speed after impact.
An empty 15,000-kg coal car moving at 5.0 m/s receives 5000 kg of coal vertically. Find final speed.
Sand drops at 2000 kg/min onto a belt moving horizontally at 250 m/min. Find the force needed to drive the conveyer.
Two masses: 8 kg at 11 m/s (x-dir) and 4 kg at −7 m/s (x-dir), collide and stick. Find final velocity.
A 1200-kg gun fires an 8.00-kg projectile at 600 m/s, 30° above horizontal. Find gun’s horizontal recoil speed.
Three masses: 2 kg at y = 300 cm, 6 kg at y = 150 cm, 4 kg at y = −75 cm. Find y-coordinate of center of mass.
Four masses in xy-plane: 300 g at (0,2.0 m), 500 g at (−2.0 m, −3.0 m), 700 g at (50 cm, 30 cm), 900 g at (−80 cm, 150 cm). Find center of mass.
A ball of mass m at origin explodes into two pieces. One of 0.270m is at x = 70 cm. Where is the other?
A ball of mass m at rest at the origin explodes into three pieces. One is at x = 40 cm, another at x = 20 cm, y = −60 cm. Find the third piece's position.

What average force must act on a 3.0-kg mass to reduce speed from 65 cm/s to 15 cm/s in 0.20 s?

Two equal-mass balls moving at 3 m/s collide head-on. Find their speed after impact if (a) they stick, (b) perfectly elastic, (c) e = 1/3.
A 90-g ball at 100 cm/s collides with 10-g stationary ball. Find their speeds after impact for (a) stick, (b) elastic, (c) e = 0.90.
A ball is dropped and bounces to 81 cm after first hitting from 144 cm. (a) Find coefficient of restitution. (b) Find height on 3rd bounce.
Two identical balls collide. Ball 1: (vₓ, vᵧ) = (40, 0) cm/s, Ball 2: (−30, 20) cm/s. Ball 1 is stopped. Find final velocity of Ball 2.
Two balls of equal mass moving at 30 cm/s collide elastically. After collision, one moves at 30° above −x. Find speeds of both balls.
(a) What thrust must engines of a 2.0 × 10⁵ kg rocket exert to lift it? (b) If ejecting gas at 20 kg/s, how fast must gases exit?
